characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: This armor provides a 9+ Primary Save against Ballistic Weapons.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: This armor provides a 8+ Primary Save against Melee and Ballistic Weapons.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: This armor provides a 7+ Primary Save against Melee and Ballistic Weapons, however the model equipped suffers a -1 to their Initiative.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: This armor provides a 10+ Primary Save against Ballistic Weapons, improve this to an 8+ when you have benefit of Cover and grants +1 to Initiative and Movement Characteristic.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
Clan Cane's Training: All INFANTRY Models in this Army Organization Chart gain +1 to their Discipline and Willpower. Anytime a Model/Unit is forced to take a Fall Back Movement, instead they take a Discipline Test and if they succeed, they ignore it.


PIONEER Infantry Units ignores the Distrusted Ally Special Rule.

characteristics.name: Lore
characteristics.$text: Clan Cane was the first Clan to join the Valerius Alliance and stood alongside it during it's fledgling years. Clan Cane contributes officers of it's clan to the Alliance Regiments to guide training, many of these officers are given the highest respects as their training is a step-above most others. Clan Cane's greatest and most decisive action was their full trust of the Pioneers, as unlike other Clans, they welcomed them with open arms; even refusing to teach Regiments that refused adoption or proper care of the Pioneers. However the ever-defiant Clan has ignored the pleas and bribes of many, and those Regiments that are taught alongside the Pioneers now see greater success than ever before.

characteristics.name: Lore
characteristics.$text:
Clan Kilroy has it's history rooted in the criminal undergrounds of the Valerius system with indomitable control over the market of Walkers and Mechanicals, it was until the days of the full reconstruction of Valerius Prime where they fought against the fledgling Alliance Regiments. However, unlike other criminal organizations and empires crushed, the Kilroy Under-Empire was found to be a potential ally as their understanding and specialization into Walkers and Mechanicals was a rare skill amongst the forming Clans, and thus, were offered a proper chance of life as an Alliance Clan.


Clan Kilroy now provides their services for anything to do with Walkers and Mechanicals: Mechanics, Pilots, Strategists, even serving as frontline leaders, the adrenaline of which is said to match their days of criminal-hood.

rules.name: Support Carrier
rules.description: This Vehicle counts as an Artillery Unit for the Artillery Coordination Special Rule. The Missile Rack can only fire once per round, and cannot be used if the Support Carrier has moved.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
If a Headquarters Unit has a comm-link, then one squad with a comm-link each turn can use that HQ Unit's Discipline or Willpower Characteristic no matter where they are on the battlefield. You can use the comm-link anytime, even if the Headquarters Unit is within a transport.

If the model equipped with this upgrade dies, this equipment is no longer in play.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
The Model equipped with this upgrade gains the Medic Special Rule, but it only benefits to the Unit it is with.

If the model equipped with this upgrade dies, this equipment is no longer in play.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
Once per round, a model equipped with a Artillery Signal may declare to use it. It rolls 4d6 for Range, then choose an enemy unit within that range that is also within line of sight, then select one Friendly Artillery Unit that also has line of sight to perform a (BS) Shooting action against it; even if it has already activated this round.

If the model equipped with this upgrade dies, this equipment is no longer in play.
